tls:text.tls:line: “Step forward, Perfected!
“Step forward, Perfected!
“Step forward, Perfected!
You have been coming to study the doctrine for such a long time.
You have really learnt it all by now, don’t you think?”

sense.def: from late Warring States times onwards: in actual fact, in point of fact; in reality; truly, in truth; indeed

tls:text.tls:line: You have really learnt it all by now, don’t you think?”

sense.def: by this time, already; after; after a while

tls:text.tls:line: But as soon as I am faced with your words,

sense.def: be exposed to; become aware of, notice; be aware of; perceive; have noticed HANSHU: 凡人之智能見已然不能見將然

tls:text.tls:line: I understand that in a way it is not enough.

sense.def: and thereupon, and then accordingly; then without delay;Then accordingly (often after a direct speech)

tls:text.tls:line: I understand that in a way it is not enough.
but I don’t know what further question to ask.

sense.def: should appropriately; be due to, be supposed to; be bound to; must; HANSHU 65: ought to (be caned); deserve to; shouldNOTE THAT MANY OF THESE ATTRIBUTIONS HAVE TO BE MOVED TO vt[0]+V[0]

tls:text.tls:line: Come here.
In this world, what is it one calls “rich” or “satisfactory”
In this world, what is it one calls “rich” or “satisfactory”

sense.def: give a (new) name to, baptise, rename; choose to call by (a designation)

tls:text.tls:line: In this world, what is it one calls “rich” or “satisfactory”

sense.def: be in abundance; be in rich sufficient supply

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.2 WANG MING 1979 p. 29-30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, HENDRISCHKE 2006 p.69

tls:text.tls:line: “Take someone, for example, who cheats, deceives, flatters, steals and robs much. (has much wickednes, hypocrisy, villainy CH)

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.2 WANG MING 1979 p. 29-30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, HENDRISCHKE 2006 p.69

tls:text.tls:line: “Take someone, for example, who cheats, deceives, flatters, steals and robs much. (has much wickednes, hypocrisy, villainy CH)

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.2 WANG MING 1979 p. 29-30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, HENDRISCHKE 2006 p.69

tls:text.tls:line: while the rulers and kings have little, (and rulers have little)

sense.def: ruler of some kind or another

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.2 WANG MING 1979 p. 29-30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, HENDRISCHKE 2006 p.69

tls:text.tls:line: “As a foolish and stupid person, when the Teacher from Heaven set out to instruct me

sense.def: I, a stupid and benighted student

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.2 WANG MING 1979 p. 29-30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, HENDRISCHKE 2006 p.69

tls:text.tls:line: I am not good enough. I am at fault. “

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.3 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69.

tls:text.tls:line: how shall the common people know the meaning of poor and rich?”

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.3 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69.

tls:text.tls:line: “If you would only think of your disciple’s ignorance

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.3 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69.

tls:text.tls:line: “If you would only think of your disciple’s ignorance

tls:text.tls:srcline: 須父母教授之乃後有知也。」

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.3 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69.

tls:text.tls:line: who must be instructed by its father and mother before it gains understanding.”

sense.def: teach so as to transmit> transmit through teaching

tls:text.tls:srcline: 須父母教授之乃後有知也。」

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.3 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69.

tls:text.tls:line: who must be instructed by its father and mother before it gains understanding.”

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.3 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69.

tls:text.tls:line: You may be excessively modest

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.3 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69.

tls:text.tls:line: You may be excessively modest

sense.def: be humble and yielding in one's demeanour, behave with polite humility

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.3 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69.

tls:text.tls:line: But still you don’t go amiss.”

sense.def: still surely; nonetheless surely; still likewise; still

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.3 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69.

tls:text.tls:line: But still you don’t go amiss.”

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: “Collect your thoughts.

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: “Collect your thoughts.

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: I will explain everything to you.

sense.def: all the objects one by one

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: We speak of “richness”

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: when there is sufficiency in all respects.

sense.def: all; completely; exhaustively; all one after the other

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: when there is sufficiency in all respects.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 天以凡物悉生出為富足，

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: By making everything grow, heaven provides richness and sufficiency. [Heaven regards it as being “completely rich” to bring forth all manner of creatures.

sense.def: Han usage: LH: all (NPs); also: any, as in He Yan on LY 1.2: 上謂凡在己上者

tls:text.tls:srcline: 天以凡物悉生出為富足，

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: By making everything grow, heaven provides richness and sufficiency. [Heaven regards it as being “completely rich” to bring forth all manner of creatures.

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: Thus when supreme majestic qi arises

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: and twelve thousand kinds of creatures are brought to life

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: and twelve thousand kinds of creatures are brought to life

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: we say that there is richness and sufficiency.

sense.def: be in abundance; be in rich sufficient supply

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: Under the influence of medium majestic qi creatures are slightly deficient

sense.def: of ordinary excellence, of middle excellence, medium majestic

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41. Wangp. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 69-70.

tls:text.tls:line: When under the influence of lower majestic qi, plants and beings are again fewer than under the influence of medium majestic qi,

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.5 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41-42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: When there are no auspicious portents [signifying the approach of majestic qi] at all,

sense.def: CC, fengyou: auspicious and magic (chart); LIJI 6.72f: auspicious insignia of ran This is very close to xiáng 祥, but more elevated in style and tends to be used nominally.

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.5 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41-42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: When there are no auspicious portents [signifying the approach of majestic qi] at all,

sense.def: (heavenly or supernatural) response (to what happens on earth); supernatural reaction/sign

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.5 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41-42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: which is extreme low poverty.

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.5 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41-42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: which is extreme low poverty.

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.5 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41-42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: Should they not possess any rare and valuable objects,

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.5 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41-42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: Should they not possess any rare and valuable objects,

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.5 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41-42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: Should they not possess any rare and valuable objects,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 萬物不能備足為下極貧家，

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.5 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41-42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: Should they not be supplied with what they need, they must be seen as an extremely poor family.

sense.def: provide for in sufficient quantities; provide for suffiently

tls:text.tls:srcline: 萬物不能備足為下極貧家，

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.5 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41-42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: Should they not be supplied with what they need, they must be seen as an extremely poor family.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 萬物不能備足為下極貧家，

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.5 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 41-42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: Should they not be supplied with what they need, they must be seen as an extremely poor family.

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.6 WANG MING 1979 p. 30, YU LIMING 2001 p. 42, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 70.

tls:text.tls:line: Such complete damage would eradicate a poor family. (a family completely empty of all resources CH)

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.21 WANG MING 1979 p. 33-34, YU LIMING 2001 p. 44, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 72-73.

tls:text.tls:line: which has caused there to be fewer girls than boys.

sense.def: in relation to; as compared to (see also THAN)

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.36 WANG MING 1979 p. 36, YU LIMING 2001 p. 46, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 75.

tls:text.tls:line: Yang is single (odd CH)

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.36 WANG MING 1979 p. 36, YU LIMING 2001 p. 46, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 75.

tls:text.tls:line: and Yin is as pair. (even CH)

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.37 WANG MING 1979 p. 36, YU LIMING 2001 p. 46, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 75-76.

tls:text.tls:line: Later generations have multiplied the world’s trespasses,

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 41.37 WANG MING 1979 p. 36, YU LIMING 2001 p. 46, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 75-76.

tls:text.tls:line: Man is heir to heaven’s dispensation

sense.def: harmonious government system, comprehensive government system

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 52.3 WANG MING 1979 p. 72, YU LIMING 2001 p. 73, tr. HENDRISCHKE 2006 p. 174.

tls:text.tls:line: they become less attractive,

sense.def: deserve to be V-ed; merit V-ing

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 67.9 Wang p. 169. Yu p.145. Hendrischke, IKGF Erlangen, ed. and trans.

tls:text.tls:line: and a number of worthy men have agreed with what [the sages] have said.

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 70.4 Wang p. 173. Yu p. 148, Hendrischke, IKGF Erlangen, ed. and trans.

tls:text.tls:line: Sometimes there is a cure and sometimes there is no cure.

sense.def: on some occasions... on other occasions; sometimes..., at other times

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 72.3 Wang p. 175. Yu p.149. Hendrischke, IKGF Erlangen ed. and trans.

tls:text.tls:line: Some reach what is inside

sense.def: some... others (often hard to distinguish from "either... or"); some..., the others

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 72.3 Wang p. 175. Yu p.149. Hendrischke, IKGF Erlangen ed. and trans.

tls:text.tls:line: while others reach what is outside.

sense.def: a certain npro belonging to the category N [many examples of SOME need to be moved here!CH]; certain such npros

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 72.13 Wang p. 176. Yu p.150. Hendrischke, IKGF Erlangen, ed. and trans.

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, a sage king must give weight to the root.

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 74.4 Wang p. 179. Yu p. 152. Hendrischke, IKGF Erlangen, ed. and trans.

tls:text.tls:line: Some will be expert in regard to the upper parts of the body,

sense.def: some... others (often hard to distinguish from "either... or"); some..., the others

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 77.17 Wang p. 185. Yu p. 156. Hendrischke, IKGF Erlangen, ed. and trans.

tls:text.tls:line: Worthy men put them in sequence so that they replace each other

sense.def: those who are possessed of moral worth and talent (at a certain time or in a certain place)

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 77.17 Wang p. 185. Yu p. 156. Hendrischke, IKGF Erlangen, ed. and trans.

tls:text.tls:line: Worthy men put them in sequence so that they replace each other

sense.def: abstractly: the man of talent and moral worth (at any time and in any place)

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 108.25 Wang p. 289. Yu p. 237.

tls:text.tls:line: and the sixth the worthy.

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 108.26 Wang p. 289. Yu p. 237.

tls:text.tls:line: the worthy assists the wise man

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 153.17 Wang p. 425. Yu p. 349.

tls:text.tls:line: We keep in mind that heaven and earth has made father and mother bring us to life and raise us.

sense.def: nourish; take good care of the needs of

tls:line.title: 太平經(en)
tls:line.loc: TPJ 153.20 Wang p. 425. Yu p. 349.

tls:text.tls:line: Being a foolish student I have asked the wrong question

sense.def: try to control; meddle in 不聞不問
